title: Welcome to Interdisciplinary Research Methods!
text:
Goals

Understand fundamental concepts in doing good research
Develop skills for establishing interdisciplinary collaborations
Gain exposure to a variety of research approaches
Learn how to apply a research method to a topic relevant to your research
Improve critical thinking ability and writing skills with regards to research methods


Help us to develop a class that is interesting and useful to Purdue graduate students

title: Welcome to Interdisciplinary Research Methods!
text:
Class Sessions

Tuesdays

A guest lecture from an expert in the week’s topic
Typically 2-3 readings

Thursdays

Seminar-style discussion of the readings provided by the guest lecturer and 1-2 more social science specific readings chosen by me
1-2 students will prepare and circulate a set of discussion questions and then lead a discussion about the readings
Sign up now for 2 Thursdays to lead discussion

Grading

Self-grading

Goal is to build structures that encourage learning and accountability
Two self-reflection assignments
Assignments get feedback, not grades
You will assign yourself a grade at the end of the semester. If I disagree I will reach out.
